thread.title: Hustus helps Mustangs boys soccer hoof it past rival Lions
thread.title_full: Hustus helps Mustangs boys soccer hoof it past rival Lions

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Mark Haskell)
title: Hustus helps Mustangs boys soccer hoof it past rival Lions
text:
Hustus helps Mustangs boys soccer hoof it past rival Lions Senior captain's four-goal performance leads Mount View to second win By Mark Haskell | Oct 01, 2015 Photo by: Mark Haskell View More... 
Belfast — With both high school boys soccer teams well outside the Maine Principals' Association Class B North playoff chase, the only thing at stake on Dennis “Bear” Bryant Field on Thursday afternoon, Oct. 1 was good old-fashioned Waldo County pride as Belfast hosted rival Mount View of Thorndike. 
The Lions were winless heading into the contest and the Mustangs only one game better, but the visitors doubled that number by game's end as they stampeded the hosts en route to a 6-2 victory. 
Click for photos from the varsity and javyee games. 
Watch video below. 
Mount View held a 3-0 lead at halftime, with all three scores in the first 40 minutes coming from senior forward Mikey Hustus. 
Hustus added a fourth goal late in the game off a penalty kick, while Brandon Reynolds and Matt Overlock also creased the net for the 'Stangs. 
Skylar Perkins and Phil Wich found the back of the net for Belfast. 
Seth Davis played in goal for Mount View, while Andrew Cross minded the net for Belfast. 
Mount View held a 17-6 edge in shots, while both teams attempted two corner kicks. 
Hustus scored the first two goals of the game with 36:57 and 12:34 left in the first half, respectively, and completed his hat trick with time winding down in the same half, when a Mustang teammate placed a ball perfectly over a swarm of Lion players to Hustus, who had half a step on the Belfast defender. 
Hustus then leapt into the air and struck the ball in stride and over the Lion keeper for an impressive goal to put the visitors up three scores with 3:56 remaining. 
Reynolds also had an impressive goal in the second half when he outran a Lion defender and fired a rocket into the short side of the goal near the end line for Mount View with 20:51 left in the game. 
Hustus and Perkins traded penalty kicks in the second half for Mount View and Belfast, respectively, while Wich scored on a header with his back to the net off a pass from a teammate with 1:44 remaining in the contest. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Mount View (1-8, 2.9082 points) is 17th, while Belfast (0-8, no points) is 18th. Ellsworth (7-0-1, 57.9082 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Thursday's outcome is not reflected in the Heal Points, thus, the Mustangs are 2-8 and the Lions 0-9. 
Courier Publications' sports staff can be reached by email at sports@villagesoup.com or by phone at 594-4401. Mount View at Belfast boys soccer Belfast hosts Mount View of Thorndike high school boys soccer on Oct. 1. (Video by: Mark Haskell and Holly Vanorse Spicer)
